greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lower triangular matrix T, read by rows, that shifts left one column under the matrix square of T, with T(n,0)=T(n,1) for n>0 and T(n,n)=1 for n>=0.
comment: Column 0 forms A002449, the number of different types of binary trees of height n. Row sums form A098540. Column 1 equals A098541. As a matrix, T satisfies [T^2](n,k) = T(n+1,k+1) for all n,k>=0, where [T^2] denotes the matrix square of T, with T(0,k)=[T^2](k,0) and T(k,k)=1 for all k>=0. This is a variant of triangle A078121.
example: showing that T^2 is the same as T after shifting left one column.
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Sep 13 2004
